page.title: 06Modern Heywood.
page.content: The Twentieth Century has seen a steady decline in the {Cotton {Industry,}but quite a lot still remains. Other old industries still survive, like {paper making and rope {making.}New industries such as{ light {engineering and small metal works}have come into the town. The most recent growth area has been in the {storage {and warehousing industries.}The other new development has been the { {Motorways. }The old transport systems have gone, the canal has been filled in, and the railway was closed in the 1960's. The new roads, the {M62 and {M66,}run very close to the town. Local Government reorganisation made the town part of the Borough of Rochdale, yet it still has links with Manchester and wishes to retain its separate identity. What follows are the views of Heywood people about their town.
